alert.note: Alert for George; Greene; Perry; Stone (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 05 at 10:47AM CDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Monroe, Mobile, northwestern Baldwin, southern Washington, south central Clarke, western Escambia, George, southeastern Perry, southern Greene and Stone Counties through 1130 AM CDT... At 1047 AM CDT, National Weather Service doppler radar indicated strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 3 miles west of Calvert to 12 miles southeast of Leakesville to 8 miles west of Lucedale to 11 miles east of Wiggins to 5 miles west of Perkinston. Movement was southeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Midtown Mobile, Downtown Mobile, Prichard, Tillmans Corner, Saraland, Bay Minette, Atmore, Chickasaw, Satsuma, Spanish Fort, Wiggins, Citronelle, Lucedale, Creola, Leakesville, Chunchula, Stockton, McCullough, Stapleton and Perkinston. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 200 PM CDT for south central and southwestern Alabama...northwestern Florida...and southeastern Mississippi.
